file.content:
name: Promote CLI to Latest

on:
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  promote:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '22'
          registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org/'

      - name: Set up Homebrew
        uses: Homebrew/actions/setup-homebrew@master

      - name: Set up Git
        run: |
          git config --global user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config --global user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"

      - name: Run promote script
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN }}
          NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
        run: npm run cli:release:latest

content.content:
1→#!/bin/bash
     2→
     3→PACKAGE_NAME=$(node -p "require('./package.json').name")
     4→LATEST_BETA=$(npm view "$PACKAGE_NAME" dist-tags.beta)
     5→
     6→echo "Promoting $PACKAGE_NAME@$LATEST_BETA to latest"
     7→npm dist-tag add "$PACKAGE_NAME@$LATEST_BETA" latest
     8→
     9→brew tap appdotbuild/tap
    10→brew bump-formula-pr --version="$LATEST_BETA" --no-fork --no-browse appdotbuild/tap/app.build
    11→

file.content:
#!/bin/bash

PACKAGE_NAME=$(node -p "require('./package.json').name")
LATEST_BETA=$(npm view "$PACKAGE_NAME" dist-tags.beta)

echo "Promoting $PACKAGE_NAME@$LATEST_BETA to latest"
npm dist-tag add "$PACKAGE_NAME@$LATEST_BETA" latest

brew tap appdotbuild/tap
brew bump-formula-pr --version="$LATEST_BETA" --no-fork --no-browse appdotbuild/tap/app.build

file.content:
# Requirements

This project needs some dependencies in order to run, make sure to have them all installed.

### npm

Make sure to have node installed using [nvm](https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm)

### pnpm

Run the following command

```bash
npm install --global corepack@latest
corepack enable pnpm
```

### koyeb

Run

```bash
brew install koyeb/tap/koyeb
```

or

```bash
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/koyeb/koyeb-cli/master/install.sh | sh
```

Docs [here](https://www.koyeb.com/docs/build-and-deploy/cli/installation)

## 1Password CLI

Run

```bash
brew install 1password-cli
```

Docs [here](https://developer.1password.com/docs/cli/get-started)

## Setting up 1Password

Make sure you also have the app installed. Open the 1Password app, and go to settings.

Activate the "Integrate with 1Password CLI

![1Password CLI integration](docs/images/1password-integration.png)

## Setting up the project

First of all, go to [Neon console](https://console.neon.tech/app/projects/damp-surf-76179452/branches/br-proud-wave-a84j8pq6?branchId=br-proud-wave-a84j8pq6&database=neondb) into the app.build Organization

![Organization Picker](docs/images/organization-picker.png)

If you don't have access, please ask a member of the team to invite you, and wait until you have access to continue this instructions.

Now go into branches, and create a branch with the following structure `dev-<yourname>`

![Branch creation](docs/images/branch-creation.png)

Now go into your branch, and click on `Connect`, copy your connection string, and execute the following command

```bash
op item create --category "API Credential" --vault "App.build" --title "DATABASE_URL_$(echo "$USER" | tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]')" 'credential=<connection-string>' 'expires=2099-12-31'
```

Now you can run the following command to setup your environment

```bash
bun setup
```

## Starting the project

First of all make sure that docker is running.

Now you will need to run 2 different terminals, one with all the necessary servers, and the other one with the CLI.

In the first terminal run

```bash
bun dev
```

In the second terminal, you can choose to run the CLI in two ways:

- Compiled version: This has a process in the background that is recompiling it everytime you make a change. But you will need to run the command again after doing changes.

```bash
bun cli
```

- Watched version: This allows you to directly see the changes you are applying (is not HMR for now).

```bash
bun cli:watch
```

### Cached prompt for development

Use this [prompt](https://github.com/appdotbuild/agent/blob/main/agent/api/agent_server/agent_api_client.py#L21) to generated an app that's already pre-built for development purposes:

```
Implement a simple app with a counter of clicks on a single button
```

### Python Client

Use this [client](https://github.com/appdotbuild/agent/blob/main/agent/api/agent_server/agent_client.py) as the sources of truth for how the SSE /message endpoint should work.

1→{
     2→  "name": "@app.build/cli",
     3→  "version": "0.0.0",
     4→  "license": "MIT",
     5→  "type": "module",
     6→  "bin": {
     7→    "app.build": "dist/entrypoint.js"
     8→  },
     9→  "files": [
    10→    "dist",
    11→    "package.json",
    12→    "README.md"
    13→  ],
    14→  "scripts": {
    15→    "build:cli": "bun run tools/build.ts",
    16→    "clean": "rm -rf node_modules dist tmp",
    17→    "dev": "tsc --watch",
    18→    "lint": "prettier --check .",
    19→    "lint:fix": "prettier --write .",
    20→    "release": "bun run build:cli && semantic-release --config release.config.mjs",
    21→    "release:latest": "sh tools/latest.sh",
    22→    "start": "node tmp/dist/cli.js",
    23→    "start:inspect": "node --inspect tmp/dist/cli.js",
    24→    "test": "prettier --check . && xo && ava",
    25→    "types:check": "tsc --noEmit"
    26→  },
    27→  "dependencies": {
    28→    "@appdotbuild/core": "workspace:*",

file.content:
{
  "name": "@app.build/cli",
  "version": "0.0.0",
  "license": "MIT",
  "type": "module",
  "bin": {
    "app.build": "dist/entrypoint.js"
  },
  "files": [
    "dist",
    "package.json",
    "README.md"
  ],
  "scripts": {
    "build:cli": "bun run tools/build.ts",
    "clean": "rm -rf node_modules dist tmp",
    "dev": "tsc --watch",
    "lint": "prettier --check .",
    "lint:fix": "prettier --write .",
    "release": "bun run build:cli && semantic-release --config release.config.mjs",
    "release:latest": "sh tools/latest.sh",
    "start": "node tmp/dist/cli.js",
    "start:inspect": "node --inspect tmp/dist/cli.js",
    "test": "prettier --check . && xo && ava",
    "types:check": "tsc --noEmit"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@appdotbuild/core": "workspace:*",
    "@inkjs/ui": "2.0.0",
    "@stackframe/js": "^2.8.6",
    "@tanstack/react-query": "5.69.0",
    "axios": "^1.8.4",
    "dotenv": "^16.4.7",
    "eventsource": "^3.0.6",
    "ink": "6.0.1",
    "ink-divider": "^4.1.1",
    "ink-markdown": "^1.0.4",
    "ink-spinner": "^5.0.0",
    "ink-syntax-highlight": "2.0.2",
    "ink-text-input": "^6.0.0",
    "jose": "^6.0.10",
    "meow": "13.2.0",
    "node-fetch": "3.3.2",
    "query-string": "^9.1.1",
    "react": "catalog:",
    "react-markdown": "^10.1.0",
    "react-router": "catalog:",
    "zod": "3.22.4",
    "zustand": "5.0.3"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@eslint/js": "9.23.0",
    "@sindresorhus/tsconfig": "^3.0.1",
    "@tanstack/eslint-plugin-query": "^5.68.0",
    "@types/node": "^22.14.1",
    "@types/react": "19.1.8",
    "bun": "1.2.5",
    "chalk": "4.1.2",
    "eslint": "9.23.0",
    "eslint-plugin-react": "7.37.4",
    "eslint-plugin-react-hooks": "5.2.0",
    "ink-testing-library": "^3.0.0",
    "prettier": "^2.8.7",
    "react-devtools-core": "^6.1.1",
    "semantic-release": "23.0.0",
    "typescript": "5.8.2",
    "typescript-eslint": "8.28.0",
    "xo": "^0.53.1"
  },
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=22"
  },
  "publishConfig": {
    "access": "public"
  },
  "patchedDependencies": {
    "@tanstack/query-core@5.69.0": "apps/cli/patches/@tanstack%2Fquery-core@5.69.0.patch",
    "ink-markdown@1.0.4": "apps/cli/patches/ink-markdown@1.0.4.patch"
  }
}

name: Promote CLI to Latest

on:
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  promote:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '22'
          registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org/'

      - name: Set up Git
        run: |
          git config --global user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config --global user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"

      - name: Run promote script
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN }}
          NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
        run: npm run cli:release:latest

input.old_string:
#!/bin/bash

PACKAGE_NAME=$(node -p "require('./package.json').name")
LATEST_BETA=$(npm view "$PACKAGE_NAME" dist-tags.beta)

echo "Promoting $PACKAGE_NAME@$LATEST_BETA to latest"
npm dist-tag add "$PACKAGE_NAME@$LATEST_BETA" latest

brew tap appdotbuild/tap
brew bump-formula-pr --version="$LATEST_BETA" --no-fork --no-browse appdotbuild/tap/app.build

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Requirements

This project needs some dependencies in order to run, make sure to have them all installed.

### npm

Make sure to have node installed using [nvm](https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm)

### pnpm

Run the following command

```bash
npm install --global corepack@latest
corepack enable pnpm
```

### koyeb

Run

```bash
brew install koyeb/tap/koyeb
```

or

```bash
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/koyeb/koyeb-cli/master/install.sh | sh
```

Docs [here](https://www.koyeb.com/docs/build-and-deploy/cli/installation)

## 1Password CLI

Run

```bash
brew install 1password-cli
```

Docs [here](https://developer.1password.com/docs/cli/get-started)

## Setting up 1Password

Make sure you also have the app installed. Open the 1Password app, and go to settings.

Activate the "Integrate with 1Password CLI

![1Password CLI integration](docs/images/1password-integration.png)

## Setting up the project

First of all, go to [Neon console](https://console.neon.tech/app/projects/damp-surf-76179452/branches/br-proud-wave-a84j8pq6?branchId=br-proud-wave-a84j8pq6&database=neondb) into the app.build Organization

![Organization Picker](docs/images/organization-picker.png)

If you don't have access, please ask a member of the team to invite you, and wait until you have access to continue this instructions.

Now go into branches, and create a branch with the following structure `dev-<yourname>`

![Branch creation](docs/images/branch-creation.png)

Now go into your branch, and click on `Connect`, copy your connection string, and execute the following command

```bash
op item create --category "API Credential" --vault "App.build" --title "DATABASE_URL_$(echo "$USER" | tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]')" 'credential=<connection-string>' 'expires=2099-12-31'
```

Now you can run the following command to setup your environment

```bash
bun setup
```

## Starting the project

First of all make sure that docker is running.

Now you will need to run 2 different terminals, one with all the necessary servers, and the other one with the CLI.

In the first terminal run

```bash
bun dev
```

In the second terminal, you can choose to run the CLI in two ways:

- Compiled version: This has a process in the background that is recompiling it everytime you make a change. But you will need to run the command again after doing changes.

```bash
bun cli
```

- Watched version: This allows you to directly see the changes you are applying (is not HMR for now).

```bash
bun cli:watch
```

### Cached prompt for development

Use this [prompt](https://github.com/appdotbuild/agent/blob/main/agent/api/agent_server/agent_api_client.py#L21) to generated an app that's already pre-built for development purposes:

```
Implement a simple app with a counter of clicks on a single button
```

### Python Client

Use this [client](https://github.com/appdotbuild/agent/blob/main/agent/api/agent_server/agent_client.py) as the sources of truth for how the SSE /message endpoint should work.

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Requirements

This project needs some dependencies in order to run, make sure to have them all installed.

### npm

Make sure to have node installed using [nvm](https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm)

### pnpm

Run the following command

```bash
npm install --global corepack@latest
corepack enable pnpm
```

### koyeb

Run

```bash
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/koyeb/koyeb-cli/master/install.sh | sh
```

Docs [here](https://www.koyeb.com/docs/build-and-deploy/cli/installation)

## 1Password CLI

Follow the installation instructions at [1Password CLI docs](https://developer.1password.com/docs/cli/get-started)

Docs [here](https://developer.1password.com/docs/cli/get-started)

## Setting up 1Password

Make sure you also have the app installed. Open the 1Password app, and go to settings.

Activate the "Integrate with 1Password CLI

![1Password CLI integration](docs/images/1password-integration.png)

## Setting up the project

First of all, go to [Neon console](https://console.neon.tech/app/projects/damp-surf-76179452/branches/br-proud-wave-a84j8pq6?branchId=br-proud-wave-a84j8pq6&database=neondb) into the app.build Organization

![Organization Picker](docs/images/organization-picker.png)

If you don't have access, please ask a member of the team to invite you, and wait until you have access to continue this instructions.

Now go into branches, and create a branch with the following structure `dev-<yourname>`

![Branch creation](docs/images/branch-creation.png)

Now go into your branch, and click on `Connect`, copy your connection string, and execute the following command

```bash
op item create --category "API Credential" --vault "App.build" --title "DATABASE_URL_$(echo "$USER" | tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]')" 'credential=<connection-string>' 'expires=2099-12-31'
```

Now you can run the following command to setup your environment

```bash
bun setup
```

## Starting the project

First of all make sure that docker is running.

Now you will need to run 2 different terminals, one with all the necessary servers, and the other one with the CLI.

In the first terminal run

```bash
bun dev
```

In the second terminal, you can choose to run the CLI in two ways:

- Compiled version: This has a process in the background that is recompiling it everytime you make a change. But you will need to run the command again after doing changes.

```bash
bun cli
```

- Watched version: This allows you to directly see the changes you are applying (is not HMR for now).


### Cached prompt for development

Use this [prompt](https://github.com/appdotbuild/agent/blob/main/agent/api/agent_server/agent_api_client.py#L21) to generated an app that's already pre-built for development purposes:

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully removed all Homebrew publishing configurations from the project:

## Changes Made:

1. **`.github/workflows/cli-release-prod.yml`**:
   - Removed Homebrew setup step
   - Removed `HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN` environment variable

2. **`apps/cli/tools/latest.sh`**:
   - Removed Homebrew tap and formula update commands
   - Now only handles npm dist-tag promotion

3. **`CONTRIBUTING.md`**:
   - Removed Homebrew installation instructions for koyeb and 1Password CLI
   - Updated to use alternative installation methods

The project no longer has any Homebrew publishing functionality. The CLI release workflow will now only promote packages to npm's latest tag without updating any Homebrew formula.
